intro: Heterotrichum squalidum, commonly known as the squalid moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, cryptogamic plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure, consisting of a flattened, leaf-like body that is covered in a layer of fine, filamentous structures. Its reproductive structures, including antheridia and archegonia, are located on the upper surface of the thallus. Heterotrichum squalidum plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
